availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas M. Jones (Hopkins County, Ky, farmer )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Son of Marshall Jones and Jennie Landin Jones. Married to Lucretia Ashby Jones in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on July 1, 1855. Father of Donaldson M. Jones, Lotin G. Jones, William Jones, Sula J. Jones, Annie L. Jones, Mildred Jones, and Florence Jones. Student in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 121B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 806.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 220A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 3, p. 55A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages, p. 1.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #28681.
"Thomas M. Jones (1834-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial #70623678, accessed October 19, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70623678.
